If all sentinel lymph nodes are negative for metastatic tumor, the N stage is N0.
The N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved and the presence of extranodal extension.
Invasive carcinoma size and multifocality do not affect the N stage.
The absence of dermal lymphatic invasion does not affect the N stage.
Calcifications, atypical ductal hyperplasia, intraductal papilloma, and non-neoplastic breast changes do not affect the N stage.
Estrogen receptor, progesterone receptor, and HER2/NEU status do not affect the N stage.
